Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jug
Description: Vase in the shape of a jug with a globular body extending into a long vertical neck and ending in a beaded lip. A high vertical handle joins the top of the neck to the shoulder. It has a small ring base. The exterior surface is red slipped and polished. It bears a geometrical design: a horizontal line at the base of the neck, four series of four parallel vertical lines joining the base of the neck to the foot.
